Diagnosis
	1. Stage IVB SMARCA4-mutant lung adenocarcinoma with bone and liver metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Jan 2024 CT-guided lung biopsy

	Radiotherapy
	15 Feb 2024 20Gy in 5# to T7-T9 vertebrae

	Chemotherapy
	Carboplatin/Pemetrexed commenced 20 Jan 2024

	Clinical studies
	None suitable

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging with mixed clinical picture

	Current issues
	Worsening bone pain despite stable imaging

	Summary of consultation
	[redacted name] attended clinic today for review of response to systemic therapy. CT scan performed last week shows stable disease in both liver and bone metastases, with the largest liver lesion unchanged at 4.2cm. However, she reports increasing bone pain particularly affecting her thoracic spine despite previous radiotherapy. Her mobility has declined and she now requires two walking sticks. Performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 2.

Blood tests show stable biochemistry but hemoglobin has dropped to 98 g/L from 115 g/L three weeks ago. Liver function remains normal. Inflammatory markers are elevated with CRP 86.

Given the mixed picture of radiologically stable disease but clinical deterioration, we have agreed to continue carboplatin/pemetrexed for one further cycle with close monitoring. I have increased her analgesia today and arranged urgent review with the palliative care team.

	Further investigations
	Repeat CT in 6 weeks
	Weekly FBC monitoring

	Medication prescribed
	Oxycodone MR increased to 40mg BD

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 2 weeks pre-cycle 4
Palliative care review next week

	Required GP actions
	Weekly FBC monitoring
Please monitor renal function
